thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL: Calvary, SCPS win playoff matches
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL: Calvary, SCPS win playoff matches | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: HIGH SCHOOL: Calvary, SCPS win playoff matches
text:
Photos Photo courtesy of Savannah Christian
The Savannah Christian volleyball team beat Mt. Paran Christian in four sets Tuesday to advance to the Class A quarterfinals.
By Savannah Morning News
The Calvary Day volleyball team defeated visiting Paideia in straight sets Tuesday to advance to the Elite Eight of the GHSA Class A playoffs. The Cavaliers won by set scores of 25-18, 25-20, 27-25.
Claudia Chisolm had 17 kills, three digs and two aces for the Cavaliers as setter Hannah Carver dished out 31 assists. Morgan Pearson had eight kills, and Basia Peragine added six kills for the Cavaliers (30-9).
The remaining teams in the tournament will be reseeded today, and the time and site of Calvary’s match Saturday will be announced.
Paideia at Calvary 25-18, 25-20, 27-25
Claudia Chisolm 17 kills, 3 digs, 2 aces; Hannah Carver 31 assists, 9 digs, ace; Morgan Pearson 8 kills, 3 digs, 2 blocks; Basia Peragine 6 kills.
SCPS wins on the road
KENNESAW — Savannah Christian went on the road and came away with a four-set victory over Mt. Paran to advance to the Class A quarterfinals. The Raiders won by set scores of 25-11, 25-27, 25-22, 25-18.
Sarah Allen had six kills and 12 digs, and Landon Jones had 17 assists, nine kills and seven digs for the Raiders (35-7). Lainey Aenchbacher had 11 kills, 20 assists, 10 digs and three aces, and Hannah White added nine kills.
Savannah Christian will find out its opponent for Saturday after the reseeding tonight.
Savannah Christian def. Mt. Paran 25-11, 25-27, 25-22, 25-18.
Top players — SCPS, Sarah Allen 6 kills, 12 digs; Landon Jones 9 kills, 17 assists, 7 digs, 19/19 serving; Adrianna Simon 8 kills, 2 blocks; Lainey Aenchbacher 11 kills, 20 assists, 3 aces, 10 digs; Mary Price Brown 4 aces, 11 digs; McKenzie Riner 5 kills, 3.5 blocks; Hannah White 9 kills, 3 blocks; Emilee Wissmach 8 digs, 6 assists, 2 aces.
SCD ends season with loss to Fellowship
ROSWELL — Savannah Country Day’s season came to an end with a straight set loss to Fellowship Christian. FC won by set scores of 25-18, 25-15, 25-11. Senior Anna Muller had eight kills and five blocks, and Abigail Kahn and Lily Glass combined for 15 assists for the Hornets, who ended the season with a 20-23 record.
Fellowship def. SCD 25-18, 25-15, 25-11
Top players — SCD, Anna Muller 8 kills, 5 blocks, 2 digs; Anna Stone 4 kills; Ana Schretter 3 kills, 7 digs; Abigail Kahn 10 assists, 3 digs; Lily Glass 5 assists, 2 digs.
Blessed Trinity beats Savannah Arts
Defending state champion Blessed Trinity beat Savannah Arts 25-12, 25-16, 25-16, ending an impressive season for the Panthers. Kerry Halliburton had 12 assists and four digs, Peyton Vacala had six kills and seven digs and Brai Fortson added five kills and three digs for the Panthers, who finished 30-9. SA coach Jeff Fortson said there was a big turnout of students, who provided vocal support for the team.
“We got a bit of a bad draw with the state champions in the second round, but I really proud of this team. They put their egos aside for the betterment of the team,” Fortson said. “And the student section had the place rocking ... I gave the crowd the game ball. If your season is going to end, that’s the best way to do it in front of a crowd that was ripping the roof off.”
Blessed Trinity def. Savannah Arts 25-12, 25-16, 25-16
Top players-Kerry Halliburton 12 assists, 4 digs; Peyton Vacala 2 aces, 6 kills, block, 7 digs; Brai Fortsen 5 kills, 3 digs.
Record-SA 30-9

Class A Private
Strong Rock Christian at Calvary Day at Jenkins Boys Club, DH, 1:30 p.m.
Class AA
Bryan County at Wesleyan, (DH)

Dalton at Richmond Hill, (DH)
